title: Is Riot out of their mind?
body:
{{champion:29}}  ADC favoritism much.

His winrate went from 53% to 51% since his last nerf. He's not quite as strong, but he's still strong.

...and currently on PBE:

Twitch
Contaminate (E) base damage increased from 20/25/30/35/40 to 20/30/40/50/60

HOW can they EVEN CONSIDER buffing a champion that's ALREADY "too" strong and has been plaguing the Rift with his cancer kit???


Edit: I checked on Champion.GG which shows his winrate to be 51% in the adc role. Other websites show a lower winrate. 

Even if his winrate is a bit lower, him getting buffed almost instantly while Riot has been ignoring other champions that have been struggling for a long time feels terribly wrong. I just think it's a shame that Riot doesn't seem to be willing to do anything about the dominance of lategame hyper carries.

replies.body:
PTA changes didn't land as we wanted. For champions that were affected by the set of changes more than intended, we are cutting back on some of their nerfs. Twitch is one of these. Shyvana is the other. Imo, the problem with this situation is that we didn't land the changes as intended in the first place much moreso than that we're following up on that miss. The primary improvement to be made here is to get it right on the first pass. We're not always going to, but we should definitely aim to.

Work on hyper carries, and ADCs more generally, does need to be done.
you guys miss all the time. its a regular thing
Yep! We should get better at that.
By the grammar in this situation, it sounds like you mean getting better at missing...
Nope! We should get worse at that.

Either way, you guys do a wonderful job, and I feel like you guys are looking too much at the little details compared to the big picture due to a portion of  player's feedback being avaricous. 

Keep up the good work.

I think managing to strike a good mix between hitting the little details and working on the big picture at the same time is important in League, but also pretty damn hard. Too much detail stuff and we never answer any big questions, just cycle strong/weak champions around. Too little detail stuff and it feels like we're not responding to the needs of players at an appropriate rate.

maybe the issue is WHICH champs you keep looking at.  It seem to be the same ones that are always in an ok play.  Then low played champs ({{champion:9}} {{champion:43}} etc) when people talk about fix you NEVER listen to the people that play them.  A lot of time the "up votes" and Riot is listening to people with ZERO games played.  

Try looking and the low played and low win rate champs.  Because a champ doesn't have a high win/play rate because he is "COOL".  Its because they are stronger and easier to win.  

LOL the big picture.... fiddle mains have been waiting YEARS on the big picture.  I'm sure others have too.  Maybe THAT is the point.

It's okay, aiming is hard when your eyes are on the side of your head!

{{champion:29}}

RiotRepertoir taking it like a man.

+50 Respect.
Respect for responding to that comment with grace

I have to agree with you on this one. Shyvana got plastered by the nerfs on top of the Press the Attack changes. It put her in a position where if she doesn't take Press the Attack, she effectively gimping herself. I know Riot has a stance on forcing champions to have to play a certain way (Keystones included), so I was pretty sure you they were going to revisit Shyvana.

She is a champion that excels at 2 things: applying damage and controlling objectives. The nerfs to Q and her scaling AD just made her feel terrible when trying to clear jungle. I get that she shouldn't come out super healthy, but she shouldn't almost die every time on the first clear.

Same with Xin, Some Xin players Liked Electrocute better then PtA. With his nerfs, like Shyvana. He is shoehorned even harder into PtA.
The convincing i'm seeing here is you're linking champions to keystones already, which means the new system is beginning to be solved. How long until the next iteration of the pre game systems?

By nerfing Xin you guys forced all xin builds to play PTA in order to stay playable.

however the biggest flaw with the nerf is that you gutted his late game power. If I recall the point of his rework in the first place was to give him more options in team fights, and to give him a stronger identity late game. Now his winrate  goes down to sub-50% as the game goes on, most likely due to the damage on his passive being halved.

Xin now needs even more damage items to even come close to killing a carry who has peel/shields.

Xin is overbearing because of his early game power. So why did you guys nerf his late game even more than you nerfed his early game? 

All you guys needed to do was keep the 80% scaling and make changes to bring his early game insanity in line.

But aren't you buffing PTA and nerfing Footwork?
Won't he be S tier again.

Also, why can Ashe and MF sit in the gutter, why a less healthy champ gets buffs.
Are they in the gutter, or is everyone else too strong?

^THIS. Ashe is the most balanced ADC right now. She also doesn't abuse crit the same way everyone else does. In fact, she makes crit look balanced because it just turns into slows for kiting, and tenacity actually affects those. (Though there's so much tenacity that her kit is kinda invalid, but no one notices thanks to all the knockups and damage....something she doesn't have)

Whenever Ashe is meta, she doesn't receive nearly as much complaints about game health. I hope to god they don't buff her and add to this power creep mess. I just want them to nerf the other ADCs (and by extension, tanks) to a reasonable level.

Ashe really isn't alright at the moment.
The problem is that her Q needs time to stack before she can use its AS steroid and more damage buff for herself and that takes too long to get, compared the easily accessible steroids and damage from the usual Marksmen. Ashe's Q needs to drop one AA from the activation requirement or that Ashe be allowed to stack her Q from her W champ hits, like it used to work when she was updated.

> His winrate from 53% to 51% since his last nerf.

Where are you getting that from? I'm seeing him lower on every site I checked. Anyway, it's still an overall nerf

Let’s just say it. This perceived “ADC favoritism” is actually just “ADC hatred” from the boards.

When WW has been 54% winrate for a long ass time but not mentioned on the boards. Or Brand... or even the Sion posts mentioning HOW FUCKING BUSTED he is get barely any upvotes.

Breaking News: Just cause a champion is well designed doesn’t mean they can’t be busted numbers wise.

Except plenty of people on the boards mention Warwick as "Why the fuck is he untouched."

The others just enjoy the fact they have a bruiser they can play fairly successfully.   I personally can't wait for Warwick to get his much deserved nerfs.

Have not seen it mentioned/no thread hit the front page. How does a champ have a 54% win rate for a while now not get a single top thread, but Kog getting _half_ his nerf reverted gets 3 hot threads.

Yeah...

48% winrate, check your data.
Also, still overall nerf to his previous state.
The problem with this boards is you dont seek balance you seek revenge, gladly letting any champ you dont like to be gutted to satisfy your "sense of justice".

He didn't get gutted. This was barely a nerf. 99% of his DMG came from ultimate right clicking out of nowhere. The lower win rate is the consequence of whiny twitch mains. Even if nerf were -1 base DMG his winrate would fall.

Your logic is so screwed by your hatred you are spewing bullshit.
"Twitch winrate dropped by 5% in 1 patch because of whiny twitch mains".
Wtf does that even mean? You really think a whopping 5% drop is some sort of placebo?
So far the only people whining nonestop are people like you exaggerating facts and manipulating details to somehow make you seem right.
I've never seen someome argue a 5% winrate drop is because of the said champ's main whining.

Placebos in League can and in fact did happen before. A Rioter told at one point how a patch note accidentally mentioned a nerf to Vladimir, but didn't actually change anything about him: after the patch hit, both his play rate _and_ win rate dropped by several percentage points, even if he was in exactly the same state as before. This is one of the reasons why Riot generally waits for at least one patch cycle to let players adjust to a champion's power adjustments. I'm not saying this is what's happening for Twitch, or that "whiny mains" are the reason his win rate dropped to 48%, but I wouldn't discount the psychological impact of such a change, particularly since Twitch has remained virtually untouched for quite some time until last week.

Also Graves during his reign in season 6. His Q got nerfed by 20 damage at rank 5. People just stopped playing him.

Of course he came back next patch because he still killed anyone in 2 autos while being tanky as shit. But placebo.
